alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 11:47AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Monroe County through 1230 PM EDT... At 1147 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Arrowhead Lake, or 10 miles west of Mount Pocono, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mount Pocono, Tobyhanna, Blakeslee, Gouldsboro State Park, Arrowhead Lake and Pocono Pines. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 287 and 293. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 3 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northeastern Pennsylvania.
